content:
Hi,
I want to organize my lean project into multiple files. I have a file called TM.lean and a file called Decidability.lean.
I want to have the stuff i wrote in TM.lean available in Decidability.lean.
Both files are in the root directory of my project.
I now tried to import TM by writing 

import TM

However there are still some errors in my TM.lean file hence lean is throwing an error if i try to import it
If i just copy and paste the contents of TM into Decidability it works just fine however

Is there a way to import TM.lean intro Decidability.lean even when TM is still incomplete ?

my lakefile looks as follows :

import Lake
open Lake DSL

package «cT-Lean» {
  -- add any package configuration options here
}

lean_lib «TM» {
  -- add library configuration options here
}

lean_lib «Decidability» {
  -- add library configuration options here
}


require mathlib from git
  "https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4.git"

@[default_target]
lean_lib «CTLean» {
  -- add any library configuration options here
}

Note: CTLean.lean is currently an unused file
HenrikT has marked this topic as resolved.
